column4: try asking your question, maybe someone else cna help until gnomefreak returns
what are you stuck on?
after i enter the command sudo tar -C /opt -x -z -v -f firefox-1.5.0.1.tar.gz, it says that there's no such file or directory
even though i've already downloaded the file from mozilla's website
where did you save the tar.gz to?
in the desktop
i've extracted it to the desktop
you have to do 'cd ~/Desktop' first.  Make sure you use a capital D
can you type the command so i can do it?
cd ~/Desktop
it still says there's no such file or directory
did you use a capital D?
yup
can you paste exactly what you typed?
first, cd ~/Desktop
then,  sudo tar -C /opt -x -z -v -f firefox-1.5.0.1.tar.gz
ok what does 'pwd' say?
what do you mean pwd?
when I put '' around something, it means it's a command to put in the terminal.  Just type 'pwd' without the quotes and see what it says
do you mean this one? firefox-1.5.0.1.tar.gz: Cannot open: No such file or directory
Error is not recoverable: exiting now
join me in #ubuntu-offtopic please?
